com.luigisgro.cqf.hjm
Class Xlet<T extends TimePoint>

java.lang.Object
  com.luigisgro.cqf.hjm.Xlet<T>
Type Parameters:
T -
All Implemented Interfaces:
CurveTimeSeriesOperator<T>
public abstract class Xlet<T extends TimePoint>
extends java.lang.Object
implements CurveTimeSeriesOperator<T>

This class embeds the common logic of a caplet and floorlet. The evaluation uses a ForwardInterestRate operator and a ZCB discount operator.

Author:
Luigi Sgro

Constructor Summary
Xlet(T present, T evaluationTime, T cashflowTime, double tenor, double timeStep)
          Creates a new caplet or floorlet
 
Method Summary
 double evaluate(CurveTimeSeries<T> scenario)
          The evaluation of the operator, taking a full time series as input, returning a scalar The input parameter is intended as a constant object, therefore implementations should not modify it

equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Xlet

public Xlet(T present,
            T evaluationTime,
            T cashflowTime,
            double tenor,
            double timeStep)
Creates a new caplet or floorlet

Parameters:
present - The present time, for discounting
evaluationTime - The evaluation time, where the interest rate is evaluated and the payoff calculated
cashflowTime - The time of the corresponding cashflow
tenor - The tenor of the caplet/floorlet
timeStep - The fraction of year corresponding to a calendar day
Method Detail

evaluate

public double evaluate(CurveTimeSeries<T> scenario)
Description copied from interface: CurveTimeSeriesOperator
The evaluation of the operator, taking a full time series as input, returning a scalar The input parameter is intended as a constant object, therefore implementations should not modify it

Specified by:
evaluate in interface CurveTimeSeriesOperator<T extends TimePoint>
Parameters:
scenario - The input curveTimeSeries
Returns:
A floating point value
